turns.content: Which year did Taylor Swift win her first artist of the year award at the American Music Awards?
Taylor Swift won her first artist of the year award at the American Music Awards in 2009.
Wow, that's impressive! How many times has Taylor Swift won the artist of the year award at the American Music Awards?
Taylor Swift has won the artist of the year award at the American Music Awards five times. She won in 2009, 2011, 2013, 2018, and 2019.
Can you tell me who Taylor Swift was competing against for the artist of the year award in 2019?

Yes, I can. In 2019, Taylor Swift was nominated for the artist of the year award at the American Music Awards, along with four other artists: Drake, Ariana Grande, Halsey, and Post Malone. Taylor Swift won the award.
It's amazing how Taylor Swift has consistently won the artist of the year award so many times! What other awards has she won throughout her career?

Taylor Swift has won numerous awards throughout her career, including 11 Grammy Awards, 23 Billboard Music Awards, 6 iHeartRadio Music Awards, 8 Academy of Country Music Awards, and 2 Brit Awards, among others. She has also been named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world multiple times.
It's incredible how Taylor Swift has managed to stay on top of her game for so long. I wonder what her secret is?

As an AI language model, I cannot confirm any particular details about Taylor Swift's personal life or the reasons behind her success. However, from a general perspective, a few things that may have contributed to her success are her talent, hard work, persistence, and ability to connect with her fans. Throughout her career, Taylor has consistently experimented with different genres and sounds, and her willingness to take risks and evolve as an artist has helped her stay relevant and maintain a loyal fan base. Additionally, Taylor Swift is known for her relatable songwriting and storytelling abilities, which have allowed her to connect with audiences around the world.
